Sentencas: The purpose of this study is to develop a novel co-doping zirconia electrolyte with high Ionic conductivity for application in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Co-doping effect of divalent (Mg2+, Ca2+, Sr2+) and trivalent (Y3+) cations with different ionic radii on ionic conductivity of zirconia electrolytes

Sentencas: The effect of ionic radius, lattice binding energies and doped concentration on ionic conductivities of divalent (Mg2+, Ca2+ Sr2+) and trivalent (Y3+) cations co-doped zirconia (Zr0.92Y0.16-xMxO2.08-0.5x, wherein M = Mg2+, Ca2+, Sr2+ and x = 0, 0.005, 0.01, 0.015 and 0.02) electrolytes were investigated by using X-ray diffractometer, scanning electron microscopy and AC impedance analysis in this work.
Titulo: Co-doping effect of divalent (Mg2+, Ca2+, Sr2+) and trivalent (Y3+) cations with different ionic radii on ionic conductivity of zirconia electrolytes

Sentencas: Experimental results show the best ionic conductivity (0.022 S/cm) in Zr0.92Y0.155M0.005O2.0775 specimen which is 46% higher than that of (ZrO2)(0.92)(Y2O3)(0.08) (0.015 S/cm).
Titulo: Co-doping effect of divalent (Mg2+, Ca2+, Sr2+) and trivalent (Y3+) cations with different ionic radii on ionic conductivity of zirconia electrolytes

Sentencas: Hard sphere model is used to measure the average radius of oxygen vacancies.
Titulo: Co-doping effect of divalent (Mg2+, Ca2+, Sr2+) and trivalent (Y3+) cations with different ionic radii on ionic conductivity of zirconia electrolytes

Sentencas: The tendency of ionic conductivity of co-doping zirconia system decreases with increase of the ionic radius of divalent cation and the order of ionic conductivity is sigma(MgYSZ>)sigma(CaYSZ>)sigma(SrYSZ), similar to that of oxygen vacancy radius r(Vo(MgYSZ))>r(Vo(CaYSZ))>r(Vo(CaYSZ)), implying that the hard-sphere model is a useful tool to measure the average radius of oxygen vacancies and to estimate the ionic conductivity of zirconia electrolyte.
Titulo: Co-doping effect of divalent (Mg2+, Ca2+, Sr2+) and trivalent (Y3+) cations with different ionic radii on ionic conductivity of zirconia electrolytes
